sentences.sContent: Stained glass windows, ceramic chimney and floral motifs adorn the house and make it an awe inspiring space for recluse.
sentences.sContent_eng: Stained glass windows, ceramic chimney and floral motifs adorn the house and make it an awe inspiring space for recluse.
sentences.sCn: 彩色玻璃窗户，陶瓷灯罩和花纹图案装饰的房子，让它对隐士来说成为一个令人敬畏的空间。

sentences.sContent: Nancy: Well, suit yourself. I don't recommend turning down too many invitations or you'll get a reputation for being a recluse.
sentences.sContent_eng: Nancy: Well, suit yourself. I don't recommend turning down too many invitations or you'll get a reputation for being a recluse.
sentences.sCn: 好吧，随你吧。我不建议你拒绝太多邀请，不然你会被别人当成一个隐居者（孤僻的人）

sentences.sContent: Terror of the lecher hope of the mad recluse: the sky! Black cover of the great cauldron in which boils vast imperceptible humanity.
sentences.sContent_eng: Terror of the lecher hope of the mad recluse: the sky! Black cover of the great cauldron in which boils vast imperceptible humanity.
sentences.sCn: 纵欲者的恐惧，疯隐士的希望：天空！那口大锅的黑色盖子锅中沸煮着无数渺小的人类。

remMethod.val: re + clus (关闭) + e → 把门关上 → 隐居的

trans.tranOther: someone who chooses to live alone, and does not like seeing or talking to other people
